title: Cleaning Out a VSI Deicing Sprayer for Storage

tasks.task: Drain and clean the liquid de-icing system before storage.
subtasks: Add soap (e.g., Dawn) to the tank.
Recirculate the water in the system for 5 minutes.
Pump out the water through the boom to clean electronics.

tasks.task: Top off the fuel tank and add fuel stabilizer.
Clean filters and filter elements.
subtasks: Check and possibly change the filter.

tasks.task: Inspect and treat the engine.
subtasks: Apply oil to engine parts prone to corrosion (e.g., recoil cover).
Ensure the engine is free of salt residue.
Consider fogging the engine with oil.

tasks.task: Maintain wiring and connections.
subtasks: Clean and apply dielectric grease to connections.
Apply protective oil to metal surfaces.

tasks.task: First, the main task is obviously "drain and clean the liquid de-icing system before storage." That should be the overarching MAINTASK. Let me confirm the key steps mentioned in the video.
"top off the fuel tank and add fuel stabilizer."

Next, cleaning the filters and filter elements. The video says, "One is we have our filter element... Usually you don't mess with this a whole lot... But at the end of the season we do like to clean that out again..." Then they mention draining the pump and getting rid of any leftover product. Another subtask could be "clean filters and filter elements" under the main MAINTASK.
"inspect and treat the engine." Subtasks could be:
"maintain wiring and connections." Subtasks include:

So in total, I think the key MAINTASK is the overall system draining and cleaning, with subsequent tasks for fuel, filters, engine, and wiring. This seems to cover the major steps described in the video.
Drain and clean the liquid de-icing system before storage.**
Top off the fuel tank and add fuel stabilizer.**
Clean filters and filter elements.**
Inspect and treat the engine.**
Maintain wiring and connections.**
